byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink contributed reporting from Tehran, and Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Michael S. Schmidt from Washington.
byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER, ERIC SCHMITT and HELENE COOPER

abstract: Iran returns two American military patrol boats and releases their crews, averting possible crisis; United States officials try to clarify how boats ended up in Iranian territorial waters in Persian Gulf, but are unable to explain how military lost contact with both vessels; Obama administration attributes quick release of sailors to new diplomatic relationship with country in wake of nuclear accord.

headline.print_headline: Sailors’ Release Staves Off Crisis for U.S. and Iran
headline.main: Iran’s Swift Release of U.S. Sailors Hailed as a Sign of Warmer Relations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

snippet: It remained unclear who decided to release the sailors or how their two patrol boats ended up in Iranian territorial waters.
lead_paragraph: It remained unclear who decided to release the sailors or how their two patrol boats ended up in Iranian territorial waters.
